verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that on one of those days, as he taught the people in the temple, and preached the gospel, the chief priests and the scribes came upon him with the elders,
verses.web: On one of those days, as he was teaching the people in the temple and preaching the Good News, the priests and scribes came to him with the elders.
verses.ct: One day, while Jesus was teaching the people in the temple and proclaiming the good news, the chief priests, scribes, and elders approached him.

verses.kjv: And spake unto him, saying, Tell us, by what authority doest thou these things? or who is he that gave thee this authority?
verses.web: They asked him, “Tell us: by what authority do you do these things? Or who is giving you this authority?”
verses.ct: They demanded, "Tell us — by what authority are you doing these things? Who gave you this authority?"

verses.kjv: And he answered and said unto them, I will also ask you one thing; and answer me:
verses.web: He answered them, “I also will ask you one question. Tell me:
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "Let me ask you a question first. Answer me this:

verses.kjv: The baptism of John, was it from heaven, or of men?
verses.web: the baptism of John, was it from heaven, or from men?”
verses.ct: Was John's baptism from heaven, or was it merely a human invention?"

verses.kjv: And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why then believed ye him not?
verses.web: They reasoned with themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Why didn’t you believe him?’
verses.ct: They debated among themselves, saying, "If we say 'from heaven,' he'll ask, 'Then why didn't you believe him?'

verses.kjv: But and if we say, Of men; all the people will stone us: for they be persuaded that John was a prophet.
verses.web: But if we say, ‘From men,’ all the people will stone us, for they are persuaded that John was a prophet.”
verses.ct: But if we say 'from humans,' the whole crowd will stone us, because they're convinced John was a prophet."

verses.kjv: And they answered, that they could not tell whence it was.
verses.web: They answered that they didn’t know where it was from.
verses.ct: So they answered that they didn't know where it came from.

verses.kjv: And Jesus said unto them, Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.
verses.web: Jesus said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”
verses.ct: Jesus said to them, "Then I won't tell you by what authority I do these things either."

verses.kjv: Then began he to speak to the people this parable; A certain man planted a vineyard, and let it forth to husbandmen, and went into a far country for a long time.
verses.web: He began to tell the people this parable. “A man planted a vineyard, and rented it out to some farmers, and went into another country for a long time.
verses.ct: He then told the people this parable: "A man planted a vineyard, rented it out to some tenant farmers, and left for a distant country for a long time.

verses.kjv: And at the season he sent a servant to the husbandmen, that they should give him of the fruit of the vineyard: but the husbandmen beat him, and sent him away empty.
verses.web: At the proper season, he sent a servant to the farmers to collect his share of the fruit of the vineyard. But the farmers beat him, and sent him away empty.
verses.ct: When harvest season came, he sent a servant to the farmers to collect his share of the vineyard's produce. But the farmers beat the servant and sent him away with nothing.

verses.kjv: And again he sent another servant: and they beat him also, and entreated him shamefully, and sent him away empty.
verses.web: He sent yet another servant, and they also beat him, and treated him shamefully, and sent him away empty.
verses.ct: So the owner sent another servant. They beat him too, humiliated him, and sent him away with nothing.

verses.kjv: And again he sent a third: and they wounded him also, and cast him out.
verses.web: He sent yet a third, and they also wounded him, and threw him out.
verses.ct: He sent a third servant, and they wounded him and threw him out.

verses.kjv: Then said the lord of the vineyard, What shall I do? I will send my beloved son: it may be they will reverence him when they see him.
verses.web: The lord of the vineyard said, ‘What shall I do? I will send my beloved son. It may be that seeing him, they will respect him.’
verses.ct: Then the owner of the vineyard said, 'What should I do? I'll send my beloved son. Surely they'll respect him.'

verses.kjv: But when the husbandmen saw him, they reasoned among themselves, saying, This is the heir: come, let us kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.
verses.web: “But when the farmers saw him, they reasoned among themselves, saying, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.’
verses.ct: But when the farmers saw the son coming, they schemed together: 'This is the heir! Let's kill him so the inheritance will be ours.'

verses.kjv: So they cast him out of the vineyard, and killed him. What therefore shall the lord of the vineyard do unto them?
verses.web: They threw him out of the vineyard and killed him. What therefore will the lord of the vineyard do to them?
verses.ct: So they dragged him out of the vineyard and killed him. Now, what will the owner of the vineyard do to them?

verses.kjv: He shall come and destroy these husbandmen, and shall give the vineyard to others. And when they heard it, they said, God forbid.
verses.web: He will come and destroy these farmers, and will give the vineyard to others.” When they heard that, they said, “May that never be!”
verses.ct: He will come and destroy those farmers and give the vineyard to others." When the people heard this, they said, "May that never happen!"

verses.kjv: And he beheld them, and said, What is this then that is written, The stone which the builders rejected, the same is become the head of the corner?
verses.web: But he looked at them and said, “Then what is this that is written, ‘The stone which the builders rejected was made the chief cornerstone?’
verses.ct: But Jesus looked straight at them and said, "Then what does this Scripture mean: 'The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone'?

verses.kjv: Whosoever shall fall upon that stone shall be broken; but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will grind him to powder.
verses.web: Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken to pieces, but it will crush whomever it falls on to dust.”
verses.ct: Everyone who stumbles over that stone will be shattered, and anyone it falls on will be ground to dust."

verses.kjv: And the chief priests and the scribes the same hour sought to lay hands on him; and they feared the people: for they perceived that he had spoken this parable against them.
verses.web: The chief priests and the scribes sought to lay hands on him that very hour, but they feared the people—for they knew he had spoken this parable against them.
verses.ct: The chief priests and scribes wanted to arrest him right then and there, but they were afraid of the people — because they knew he had aimed this parable directly at them.

verses.kjv: And they watched him, and sent forth spies, which should feign themselves just men, that they might take hold of his words, that so they might deliver him unto the power and authority of the governor.
verses.web: They watched him and sent out spies, who pretended to be righteous, that they might trap him in something he said, so as to deliver him up to the power and authority of the governor.
verses.ct: So they kept a close watch on him and sent spies who pretended to be sincere. Their goal was to catch him saying something they could use to hand him over to the governor's authority.

verses.kjv: And they asked him, saying, Master, we know that thou sayest and teachest rightly, neither acceptest thou the person of any, but teachest the way of God truly:
verses.web: They asked him, “Teacher, we know that you say and teach what is right, and aren’t partial to anyone, but truly teach the way of God.
verses.ct: These spies said, "Teacher, we know you speak and teach what is right. You don't show favoritism but truly teach God's way.

verses.kjv: Is it lawful for us to give tribute unto Caesar, or no?
verses.web: Is it lawful for us to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?”
verses.ct: So tell us — is it lawful for us to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?"

verses.kjv: But he perceived their craftiness, and said unto them, Why tempt ye me?
verses.web: But he perceived their craftiness, and said to them, “Why do you test me?
verses.ct: But Jesus saw right through their scheme and said, "Why are you trying to trap me?

verses.kjv: Shew me a penny. Whose image and superscription hath it? They answered and said, Caesar’s.
verses.web: Show me a denarius. Whose image and inscription are on it?” They answered, “Caesar’s.”
verses.ct: Show me a denarius. Whose image and inscription are on it?" They answered, "Caesar's."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Render therefore unto Caesar the things which be Caesar’s, and unto God the things which be God’s.
verses.web: He said to them, “Then give to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”
verses.ct: He told them, "Then give to Caesar what belongs to Caesar, and give to God what belongs to God."

verses.kjv: And they could not take hold of his words before the people: and they marvelled at his answer, and held their peace.
verses.web: They weren’t able to trap him in his words before the people. They marveled at his answer and were silent.
verses.ct: They couldn't trap him with his words in front of the people. Stunned by his answer, they fell silent.

verses.kjv: Then came to him certain of the Sadducees, which deny that there is any resurrection; and they asked him,
verses.web: Some of the Sadducees came to him, those who deny that there is a resurrection.
verses.ct: Then some Sadducees — who deny that there is any resurrection — came to him with a question.

verses.kjv: Saying, Master, Moses wrote unto us, If any man’s brother die, having a wife, and he die without children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.
verses.web: They asked him, “Teacher, Moses wrote to us that if a man’s brother dies having a wife, and he is childless, his brother should take the wife and raise up children for his brother.
verses.ct: They said, "Teacher, Moses wrote that if a man dies leaving a wife but no children, his brother must marry the widow and have children to carry on the dead man's family line.

verses.kjv: There were therefore seven brethren: and the first took a wife, and died without children.
verses.web: There were therefore seven brothers. The first took a wife, and died childless.
verses.ct: Now, there were 7 brothers. The first married a woman and died without children.

verses.kjv: And the second took her to wife, and he died childless.
verses.web: The second took her as wife, and he died childless.
verses.ct: The second brother married her, and he also died without children.

verses.kjv: And the third took her; and in like manner the seven also: and they left no children, and died.
verses.web: The third took her, and likewise the seven all left no children, and died.
verses.ct: The third married her, and so on through all 7 — none of them had children, and all of them died.

verses.kjv: Last of all the woman died also.
verses.web: Afterward the woman also died.
verses.ct: Finally, the woman died too.

verses.kjv: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them is she? for seven had her to wife.
verses.web: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them will she be? For the seven had her as a wife.”
verses.ct: So in the resurrection, whose wife will she be? All 7 brothers were married to her."

verses.kjv: And Jesus answering said unto them, The children of this world marry, and are given in marriage:
verses.web: Jesus said to them, “The children of this age marry, and are given in marriage.
verses.ct: Jesus answered, "People in this present age marry and are given in marriage.

verses.kjv: But they which shall be accounted worthy to obtain that world, and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry, nor are given in marriage:
verses.web: But those who are considered worthy to attain to that age and the resurrection from the dead neither marry nor are given in marriage.
verses.ct: But those who are counted worthy to reach the age to come and the resurrection from the dead will neither marry nor be given in marriage.

verses.kjv: Neither can they die any more: for they are equal unto the angels; and are the children of God, being the children of the resurrection.
verses.web: For they can’t die any more, for they are like the angels, and are children of God, being children of the resurrection.
verses.ct: They can never die again — they are like the angels. They are children of God, because they are children of the resurrection.

verses.kjv: Now that the dead are raised, even Moses shewed at the bush, when he calleth the Lord the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.
verses.web: But that the dead are raised, even Moses showed at the bush, when he called the Lord ‘The God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’
verses.ct: Even Moses proved that the dead are raised. At the burning bush, he called the Lord 'the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.'

verses.kjv: For he is not a God of the dead, but of the living: for all live unto him.
verses.web: Now he is not the God of the dead, but of the living, for all are alive to him.”
verses.ct: He is not the God of the dead but of the living, because to him everyone is alive."

verses.kjv: Then certain of the scribes answering said, Master, thou hast well said.
verses.web: Some of the scribes answered, “Teacher, you speak well.”
verses.ct: Some of the scribes responded, "Teacher, that was an excellent answer."

verses.kjv: And after that they durst not ask him any question at all.
verses.web: They didn’t dare to ask him any more questions.
verses.ct: After that, no one dared to ask him any more questions.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, How say they that Christ is David’s son?
verses.web: He said to them, “Why do they say that the Christ is David’s son?
verses.ct: Then Jesus asked them, "Why do people say that the Christ is David's son?

verses.kjv: And David himself saith in the book of Psalms, The LORD said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand,
verses.web: David himself says in the book of Psalms, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand,
verses.ct: David himself says in the book of Psalms: 'The LORD said to my Lord, "Sit at my right hand,

verses.kjv: Till I make thine enemies thy footstool.
verses.web: until I make your enemies the footstool of your feet.” ’
verses.ct: until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet."'

verses.kjv: David therefore calleth him Lord, how is he then his son?
verses.web: “David therefore calls him Lord, so how is he his son?”
verses.ct: David calls him 'Lord' — so how can he be David's son?"

verses.kjv: Then in the audience of all the people he said unto his disciples,
verses.web: In the hearing of all the people, he said to his disciples,
verses.ct: While all the people were listening, Jesus said to his disciples,

verses.kjv: Beware of the scribes, which desire to walk in long robes, and love greetings in the markets, and the highest seats in the synagogues, and the chief rooms at feasts;
verses.web: “Beware of those scribes who like to walk in long robes, and love greetings in the marketplaces, the best seats in the synagogues, and the best places at feasts;
verses.ct: "Watch out for the scribes. They love to walk around in flowing robes, soak up greetings in the marketplaces, claim the best seats in the synagogues, and take the places of honor at banquets.

verses.kjv: Which devour widows’ houses, and for a shew make long prayers: the same shall receive greater damnation.
verses.web: who devour widows’ houses, and for a pretense make long prayers: these will receive greater condemnation.”
verses.ct: They cheat widows out of their homes and then put on a show with long prayers. They will be punished most severely."
